items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
1. Evergreen Valley College Adjunct Faculty
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.13 submission and recommendation:
				 
Article 9.13 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.13 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the faculty personnel action as submitted.

1. Position Management
	 
a. Position Elimination
	 
Traffic & Campus Services Officer, 43.26% FTE, (9COPS0219C) in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 01/13/15.

Outreach/Recruitment Specialist, 91.68% FTE, (8CNSS0204C) in  Enrollment Services at Evergreen Valley College effective 01/13/15.
	 
	 
b. Position Establishment
	 
Senior Systems Administrator, 100% FTE, (9ITSS0330C) in the ITSS Department at the District Office effective 01/14/15.
	 
Traffic & Campus Services Officer, 100% FTE, (9COPS0234C) in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 01/14/15.
	 
Traffic & Campus Services Officer, 100% FTE, (9COPS0235C) in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 01/14/15. 
	 
Traffic & Campus Services Officer, 100% FTE, (9COPS0236C) in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 01/14/15.
	 
Outreach/Recruitment Specialist, 100% FTE, (8CNSS0221C) in Enrollment Services at Evergreen Valley College effective 01/14/15.
	 
	 
2. Change of Status
	 
a. Reassignment
	 
The employee is being transferred to Program Specialist, 100% FTE, (7CNSS0217C) in the Counseling Department at San Jose City College effective 01/07/15.
	 
b. Permanent Increase to Position's Yearly Work Schedule Hours
	 
The employee's position, Traffic & Campus Services Officer (9COPS0235C) work hours are permanently being increased from 11 months per year, 43.26% FTE, 900 hours per year to 12 months per year, 100% FTE, 2080 hours per year in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 12/03/14.
	 
The employee's position, Traffic & Campus Services Officer (9COPS0236C) work hours are permanently being increased from 12 months per year, 50.00% FTE, 1040 hours per year to 12 months per year, 100% FTE, 2080 hours per year in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 12/03/14.
	 
The employee's position, Outreach/Recruitment Specialist (8CNSS0221C), work hours are permanently being increased from 11 months per year, 91.68 FTE, 1907 hours per year to 12 months per year, 100% FTE, 2080 hours per year in Enrollment Services at Evergreen Valley College effective 07/01/14.
	 
c. Unpaid Leave
	 
Employee on an unpaid leave effective 01/19/15 through 01/19/16.
	 
d. Working Out of Class
	 
The employee is receiving additional pay as Groundskeeper III, 100% FTE, (8GRDS0209C) at Range 96-D in the Grounds Department at Evergreen Valley College effective 10/01/13 through 01/31/15.
	 
e. Promotion
	 
The employee is promoted to Senior Division Administrative Assistant, 100% FTE, (7MASC0201C) in the Math and Science Department at San Jose City College from Health Services Office Assistant , 87.50% FTE, in Health Services at San Jose City College effective 01/07/15.
	 
3. Separations
	 
Employee separation effective 12/30/14.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions exceeding the current bid limit of $84,100 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts, although not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions for the period of November 10, 2014 through December 9, 2014 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
Per California Public Contract Code Section 20652, "the governing board of any community college district without advertising for bids, and when the board has determined it to be in the best interest of the district, may authorize by contract, lease requisition, or purchase order ... [to] purchase materials, supplies, equipment ... and other personal property for the district in the manner in which the public corporation or agency is authorizes by law to make the lease or purchase." The contract must be based on the same prices and upon the same terms and conditions of a negotiated contract between the supplier and another public corporation agency.
On March 9, 2010 (Board Item F-10), the Board of Trustees authorized the award of a contract without advertising for bids by determining that it was in the best interest of the District to 'piggyback' on the contract between the Western States Contracting Alliance (WSCA)/National Association of State Procurement Officials (NASPO) and Dell Marketing, LLP as the single source supplier of the District's technology equipment. This agreement enabled the District to obtain the highest value for every dollar spent on technology equipment through August 31, 2014.
On August 26, 2014 (Board Item F-11), the Board of Trustees authorized the extension of the WSCA/NASPO Contract Administration approved Master Price Agreement B27160 Amendment Number 3, determining that it was in the best interest of the District to continue to 'piggyback' on the contract between WSCA/NASPO and Dell Marketing, LLP as the single source supplier of the District's technology equipment. This agreement enabled the District to obtain the highest value for every dollar spent on technology equipment through December 31, 2014. 
	 
On November 26, 2014, WSCA/NASPO Contract Administration approved Master Price Agreement B27160 Amendment Number 4, to extend the expiration date to March 31, 2015. Therefore, when considering the best interest of the District, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the extension of a piggybackable contract between WSCA/NASPO and Dell Marketing, LLP without the need to further advertise for bids on an already competitively bid contract. Attached are an affidavit of publication, an approval of award recommendation dated April 10, 2009 and the WSCA/NASPO Master Price Agreement B27160 Amendment Number 4..
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees authorize the District to extend a 'piggyback' on a contract with Dell Marketing, LLC.
items.item_text: Extension of Piggyback Dell Marketing, LLP Contract
items.item_text_raw: 13. Extension of Piggyback Dell Marketing, LLP Contract

items.item_details: This is a grant from the Bechtel Foundation in the amount of $5000.00 to support the San Jose City College Pathway to Law School program. Students successfully completing this program will have direct access to selected California law schools after completing their Bachelor's degree at any four year university. Students interested in the Pathway to Law School program at SJCC may indicate that interest through the college website and will take a series of prescribed courses including the new Street Law course.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accepts a grant from the Bechtel Foundation in the amount of $5000.00 to support the San Jose City College Pathway to Law School program.
items.item_text: Acceptance of grant from the Bechtel Foundation in support of the San Jose City College 2 + 2 + 3 Pathway to Law program
items.item_text_raw: 14. Acceptance of grant from the Bechtel Foundation in support of the San Jose City College 2 + 2 + 3 Pathway to Law program

items.item_details:
Non-resident Tuition Rate:
	 
Education Code Section 76140 requires districts' governing boards to establish the non-resident tuition rate by February 1st for the succeeding year.  Education Code 76140(e) enumerates seven options, which are attached, for a district to choose in establishing the rate.
	 
The District's current non-resident tuition rate is $199 per semester unit.  In FY 2013-2014, the District realized $1,145,429.  In order to retain and attract non-resident students, staff recommends establishing the lowest possible fee of $200 per semester unit per Option One (see attachment).
	 
Capital Outlay Fee:
	 
Education Code Section 76141 allows for a district to charge a capital outlay fee to any non-resident student.  The amount of the fee shall not exceed the amount that was expended per FTES by the District in FY 2013-2014 for capital outlay, calculated at $93 per semester unit, and shall not exceed 50% of the FY 2014-2015 non-resident tuition rate, calculated at $100 per semester unit.
	 
The District's current capital outlay fee is $4 per semester unit.  In FY 2013-2014, the District realized $23,323.  Staff is recommending maintaining the rate at $4 per semester unit in keeping with the District's retention and attraction strategy.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the non-resident tuition rate of $200 per semester unit and the capital outlay fee of $4 per semester unit for Academic Year 2015-2016.
items.item_text: Non-Resident Tuition Rate and Student Capital Outlay Fee for Academic Year 2015-2016
items.item_text_raw: 15. Non-Resident Tuition Rate and Student Capital Outlay Fee for Academic Year 2015-2016

items.item_details: This request represents an increase to the California Department of Education contract (CSPP-4540), the Independent Contractor's Agreement and the St. Elizabeth Day Home Agreement, which were previously approved on July 8, 2014.  This increase will allow San Jose City College to pay St. Elizabeth's Day Home in full for all services rendered in the 2014-2015 fiscal year.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation to the Board of Trustees to approve the Amendment to the California Department of Education contract (CSPP-4540), Independent Contractor's Agreement and St. Elizabeth's Day Home Agreement, for the 2014-2015 fiscal year. The amended contracts will increase from $137,041 to $242,481, a net increase of $105,440.

items.item_details:
On October 8, 2013 the Board of Trustees approved a contract to XL Construction in the amount of $6,100,000 to provide construction services for New District Office Building Project #39301 for the San Jose Evergreen Community College District. 
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  See attached detailed description of Change Order No. 006.  
	 
XL Construction submitted  written pricing proposals for changes detailed in the attachment that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                     $6,100,000.00
Previously Approved Changes             $   987,909.00
Change Order No. 006                         $       4,546.00
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $7,092,455.00
	 
The net change to XL Construction contract as a result of all changes issued is $992,455 which equates to 16.27% of the base contract. This change will be funded from project contingency.  No additional funding is required.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 006 in the amount of $4,546.00 to XL Construction, for the New District Office Building Project #39301.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: - New District Office Building Project #39301 – XL Construction – Change Order No. 006
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: - New District Office Building Project #39301 – XL Construction – Change Order No. 006

items.item_details:
The HVAC & Plumbing Upgrades Project #31304-18 at San Jose City College consisted of upgrades to heating, ventilation and cooling systems as well as plumbing upgrades throughout various campus buildings.  The upgrades in whole made for more efficient and better functioning equipment, which in turn minimizes cost for maintenance and operation.
	 
On February 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved the Agreement for Environmental Systems, Inc. to perform the work.  On June 9, 2014 construction activity began and on July 31, 2014, major construction activity was completed.  As of November 28, 2014, all construction work has been approved by the Architect of Record, all closeout documents have been received, and all Change Orders have been approved. 
	 
Once approved, this NOC will be filed with the County of Santa Clara, Office of the Recorder.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the NOC of the contract by Environmental Systems Inc., for the SJCC HVAC & Plumbing Upgrades Project #31304-18. Upgrades of HVAC and plumbing equipment throughout various buildings at SJCC Campus.

On July 9, 2013 the Board of Trustees approved the utilization of the Lease-Leaseback delivery method for the SJCC Physical Education Building and renovation of the existing Racquetball Building. LPAS has been contracted to design the new Physical Education facility.
	 
Following a Request For Qualifications (RFQ) issued by the District, Catalyst Consulting Group Inc., was awarded a Master Agreement by the Board of Trustees on July 11, 2013 for Physical Security Consultant Services. 
	 
PAA #SJCC-02 is for the Security Consultant Services to provide the Basis of Design, to include the identification of security devices at applicable locations in conformance with the District Standards and Guidelines, for the SJCC Physical Education Building Project.

items.item_details:
The San Jose City College (SJCC) Physical Education Building project includes demolition of an existing Field House and limited demolition in the existing Racquetball Building. The Comprehensive Asbestos and Lead Survey report, dated March 22, 2012, identifies hazardous materials that may be impacted by demolition. The demolition of the hazardous materials requires monitoring and testing.
	 
A Request For Proposal (RFP) was issued to prepare hazardous materials abatement specifications and monitor/test the abatement process. On December 19, 2014 the District received two (2) proposals in response to a RFP for Hazardous Materials Consultant services for the Physical Education Building Project #122 at the San Jose City College campus.  The proposals were evaluated by the District.  
	 
FIRM                                                     PRICE
	 
Sierra Environmental, Inc.                     $14,916
Ninyo & Moore                                      $16,800
	 
The proposals were reviewed against the requirements set forth in the RFP and ranked according to best price. The final selection was made by the District.
	 
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award a contract to Sierra Environmental, Inc. for the Hazardous Materials Consultant Services for the SJCC Physical Education Building Project #122.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) in the amount of $14,916 to Sierra Environmental, Inc., for the Physical Education Building Project #122 for Hazardous Materials Consultant Services.

items.item_text_raw: 7. Measure G – 2004 Bond Program: SJCC Physical Education Building Project #122 - Sierra Environmental, Inc. - Hazardous Materials Consultant Services Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA)

items.item_details:
On March 15, 2012 the Board of Trustees approved a Standard Form of Master Agreement to BFS Landscape Architects for Landscape Architectural Services at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
The 2025 Facilities Master Plan includes Project-15 “South Campus Connection”.  Which is further outlined in the “Landscape Programming and Assessment Services – South Campus Connection Project”, a document prepared by Meyer+Silberberg Landscape Architect, dated June 14, 2013. 
	 
The Project includes landscaping, site work, lighting, signage, site furnishing, accessible items, fences and utility connections to the project.  Walkways between the South Campus Connection and the second floor of the EVC PE building may be included at a future date, but are not included in this PAA.  The scope of PAA #EVC-03 is to provide conceptual and schematic design, design development, construction documentation and construction administration including Division of the State Architect (DSA) review and closeout for the South Campus connection.   BFS Landscape Architects proposal has been reviewed by Gilbane, and determined to be fair and reasonable.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-03 in the amount of $65,000 to Bellinger Foster Steinmetz (BFS) Landscape Architects for the Site Improvements South Campus Connection Design Services Project #32113 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Site Improvements South Campus Connection Project #32113 – Bellinger Foster Steinmetz (BFS) Landscape Architects, Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-03
items.item_text_raw: 8. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Site Improvements South Campus Connection Project #32113 – Bellinger Foster Steinmetz (BFS) Landscape Architects, Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-03

items.item_details:
On March 15, 2012 the Board of Trustees approved a Standard Form of Master Agreement to BFS Landscape Architects for Landscape Architectural Services at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
The 2025 Facilities Master Plan includes Project-8 “Library / Lot-4 Entrance”, a document prepared by Meyer+Silberberg Landscape Architect, dated June 14, 2013.  The project includes proposed pedestrian walkway between the Library/Ed.  Tech. Center (LETC) and Physical Education building to the Lot-4 entrance, and includes revisions to the LETC plaza, landscaping, site work, lighting, signage, site furnishing, accessible items, fences and utility connections to the project.  The project specific scope of PAA #EVC-04 includes conceptual and schematic design, design development, construction documentation, estimating and construction administration including Division of the State Architect (DSA) review and closeout, for the Campus Site Improvements Library / Lot-4 Entrance Project.  BFS Landscape Architects proposal has been reviewed by Gilbane, and determined to be fair and reasonable.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-04 in the amount of $100,000 to BFS Landscape Architects for the Campus Site Improvements Library / Lot-4 Entrance Project #32113 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details:
On March 27, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Bellinger Foster Steinmetz (BFS) Landscape Architects to provide design and construction administration services for the Bleachers Project at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Project Assignment Amendment #EVC-01 Revision #001 includes an extended construction administration duration due to Division of the State Architect (DSA) approval delays for the bleachers.  BFS Landscape Architects submitted written pricing proposals for changes that include additional work.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
This Revision #001 results in an add to the contract of $5,000.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.   
	 
Original Contract Amount               $31,274
Previous Approved Revisions        $         0
This Revision #001                        $  5,000
	 
Total Contract and Changes          $36,274
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Revision #001 to a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-01 in the amount of $5,000 to Bellinger Foster Steinmetz Landscape Architects, for Bleachers Project #32113-01 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details:
On May 9, 2012 the Board of Trustees approved a Standard Form of Master Agreement to Lionakis for architectural consulting services at both San Jose City and Evergreen Valley Colleges.  A proposal was submitted by Lionakis for the Automotive Technology Building program specific equipment design and construction administration that will be coordinated with the Automotive Technology Building Project Construction Schedule. 
	 
Lionakis has proposed to meet with the District end-users, the Design Team, the Contractor, and the Construction Manager on several occasions throughout the next months to inventory all the existing spaces, program specific equipment, and to develop drawings that illustrate how the department’s program specific equipment is currently being utilized.  Program specific equipment includes items such as vehicle lifts, car exhaust machines, in-ground dynamometers, AV/Telecom, and equipment not included in a general Furniture, Fixtures & Equipment (FF&E) package.  They will then continue to develop utilization drawings of the new spaces by coordinating with the end-users, furniture and equipment vendors, the District’s FF&E consultant, and by reviewing the Project drawings and specifications to determine the Scope of program specific equipment that is Owner Furnished Contractor Installed (OFCI) and the Scope that is Owner Furnished Owner Installed (OFOI).  After the program specific equipment that is intended to be repurposed by the end-users is identified, Lionakis will continue to develop a list of all new program specific equipment that is required for the new Automotive Technology Building.  
	 
The scope of PAA #EVC-02 is to provide program specific equipment consulting services including, but not limited to: space utilizations drawings for the old and new building, an inventory of all program specific equipment to be repurposed, a list of all new OFCI and OFOI equipment items needed, product submittals and specifications of all new program specific equipment, milestone schedules and updates for construction and campus coordination, meeting minutes and reports for meetings and job walks held, and moving management services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-02 in the amount of $45,000 to Lionakis, for the Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 Program Specific Equipment Consulting Services at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 Program Specific Equipment Consulting Services – Lionakis Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-02.
items.item_text_raw: 11. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 Program Specific Equipment Consulting Services – Lionakis Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-02.

items.item_details:
On December 9, 2014 the Board of Trustees approved a Standard Form of Master Agreement to KRJ Design Group for the Evergreen Valley College Furniture, Fixtures & Equipment (FF&E) Consulting Services.  A proposal was submitted by KRJ Design Group, Inc. for the Automotive Technology Building and included a Milestone Schedule that is coordinated with the Automotive Technology Building Project Construction Schedule. 
	 
KRJ Design Group, Inc. has proposed to meet with the District and the end-users, the Design Team, the Contractor, and the Construction Manager on several occasions throughout the next months to inventory all the existing spaces, equipment, and furniture and to develop “space utilization drawings” that illustrate how the department’s spaces are currently being utilized.  They will then continue to develop utilization drawings of the new spaces by coordinating with the end-users, furniture and equipment vendors, and by reviewing the Project drawings and specifications to determine the Scope that is Owner Furnished Contractor Installed (OFCI) and the Scope that is Owner Furnished Owner Installed (OFOI).  After the furniture and equipment that is intended to be repurposed by the end-users is identified, KRJ Design Group, Inc. will continue to develop a list of all new furniture and equipment that is required for the new Automotive Technology Building.  KRJ Design Group, Inc. will coordinate with the District and the end-users, the Design Team, the Contractor, and the Construction Manager throughout the entire procurement process and provide moving management services required to relocate the end-users and their belongings and the Department to the new spaces.
	 
The scope of PAA #EVC-02-FFE is to provide complete FF&E Consulting Services including, but not limited to: space utilizations drawings for the old and new building, an inventory of all FF&E items to be repurposed, a list of all new OFCI and OFOI FF&E items needed to fully furnish the building, product submittals and specifications of all new furniture, fixtures and equipment, procurement support services, milestone schedules and updates for construction and campus coordination, meeting minutes and reports for meetings and job walks held, and moving management services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-02-FFE in the amount of $90,000 to KRJ Design Group, Inc. for the Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 Furniture, Fixtures & Equipment (FF&E) Consulting Services at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 – KRJ Design Group, Inc. Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-02-FFE
items.item_text_raw: 12. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 – KRJ Design Group, Inc. Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) #EVC-02-FFE

items.item_details:
On December 10, 2013, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Guerra Construction Group in the amount of $608,900 to provide construction services for the EVC Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project #210-01 at Evergreen Valley College.   
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District requested design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 002 is for extended fencing and toilet facility rental charges as a result of Division of the State Architect (DSA) delay for the bleachers.  Change Order No 002 also includes a $0 No-Cost (213) calendar day substantial completion date extension from June 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014 as a result of DSA delay for bleacher approval.
	 
Guerra Construction Group submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the Agenda attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                    $608,900
Previously Approved Changes            $  51,300
Change Order No. 002                        $    9,383
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $669,583
	 
The net change to Guerra Construction Group's contract as a result of all changes issued is $60,683 which equates to 9.97% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 002 in the amount of $9,383 to Guerra Construction Group, for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project #210-01 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2004 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project #210-01 – Guerra Construction Group Change Order No. 002
items.item_text_raw: 13. Measure G – 2004 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project #210-01 – Guerra Construction Group Change Order No. 002

items.item_details:
On August 15, 2012 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with HMC Architects to provide design services for the South Campus Development Project at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Project Assignment Amendment EVC-02 Revision No. 002 includes an additional review and document revisions to the Low-Voltage and Telecom Division of the State Architect (DSA) approved plans and specifications, as requested by the District, to identify potential cost savings within this scope of work.  The District with their technology staff and campus police identified low-voltage, data and security needs of the College and worked with HMC Architects, its consultants and Gilbane to identify which components could be value engineered without sacrificing the District’s and College’s standard.  HMC Architects revised the plans and specifications to prepare for an anticipated savings when the scope of work is rebid this month.  HMC Architects submitted a written pricing proposal for changes that include this additional work.  The proposal was reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms. 
	 
Original Contract Amount             $3,575,000
Previous Approved Revisions       $12,200
This Revision No. 002                   $7,700
Total Contract and Changes         $3,594,900
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Revision No. 002 to Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-02 in the amount of $7,700 to HMC Architects for South Campus Development Project #32107 at Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_text_raw: 14. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College (EVC) South Campus Development Project #32107 – HMC Architects, Revision No. 002 to a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) No. EVC-02

KRJ Design Group, Inc. has proposed to meet with the District and end-users, the Design Team, the Contractor, and the Construction Manager on several occasions throughout the next months to inventory all the existing spaces, equipment, and furniture and to develop “space utilization drawings” that illustrate how the department’s spaces are currently being utilized.  They will then continue to develop utilization drawings of the new spaces by coordinating with the end-users, furniture and equipment vendors, and by reviewing the Project drawings and specifications to determine the Scope that is Owner Furnished Contractor Installed (OFCI) and the Scope that is Owner Furnished Owner Installed (OFOI).  After the furniture and equipment that is intended to be repurposed by the end-users is identified, KRJ Design Group, Inc. will continue to develop a list of all new furniture and equipment that is required for the new South Campus Development Project.  KRJ Design Group, Inc. will coordinate with the District and end-users, the Design Team, the Contractor, and the Construction Manager throughout the entire procurement process and provide moving management services required to relocate the end-users and their belongings and the department to the new spaces.
	 
The scope of this PAA to KRJ Design Group, Inc. will provide complete FF&E Consulting Services including, but not limited to: space utilizations drawings for the old and new buildings, an inventory of all FF&E items to be repurposed, a list of all new OFCI and OFOI FF&E items needed to fully furnish the building, product submittals and specifications of all new furniture, fixtures and equipment, procurement support services, milestone schedules and updates for construction and campus coordination, meeting minutes and reports for meetings and job walks held, and moving management services.

items.item_details:
On January 9, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Salas O'Brien Engineers to provide design and construction administration services for the MEP Pkg. #1 at San Jose City College.
	 
PAA SJCC-02 includes providing construction administration and design services.  Salas O'Brien Engineers submitted written pricing proposals for changes that include additional work.  This revision includes the cost for additional administrative support related to changes in the project during construction including an extended construction schedule. The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The item in this amendment results in an addition to the contract of $17,500.
	 
         Original Contract Amount                                  $49,000.00
         Previous Approved Revisions                           $  0,000.00

         Total Contract and Changes                              $66,500.00

items.item_details:
Following a request for Qualifications issued by the District, Artik Arts and Architecture was awarded a Master Agreement by the Board of Trustees on May, 24, 2012.
	 
Artik Arts and Architecture was chosen to perform design services for the New Iron Workers Training Center in Building 200 at San Jose City College.  The new Iron Workers Training Center project was initiated in the summer of 2014 but could not be accommodated during construction of the CTE Renovation Project due to schedule constraints.  Therefore, a seperate project has been created for this work.   Artik Arts and Architecture was selected to provide design services for this project. PAA JSCC-03 is for these services.  The scope for the project includes:  20 welding stations with proper utility and infrastructure support in room 207L, renovation of classroom 206L, and renovation of office 206.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) SJCC-03 in the amount of $51,000 to Artik Arts and Architecture, for CTE Iron Workers Training Center.

items.item_text_raw: 17. Measure G –2010 Bond Program: Career Technical Education (CTE) Project #31107-03, Iron Workers Training Center - Artik Arts and Architecture -Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) SJCC-03.

items.item_details:
Following a request for Qualifications issued by the District, Salas O'Brien was awarded a Master Agreement by the Board of Trustees on May 25, 2012.
	 
Salas O'Brien was the engineer for the Utility Extension for New and Existing Buildings Phase 1.  In order to provide consistency in the implementation of the Master Plan, Salas O’Brien was selected to provide design and engineering services for the Utility Extension for New and Existing Buildings Phase 2.  PAA-SJECC-04 is for these services. The scope of work includes:  new 300-Ton Chiller for the Central Plant, Cooling Tower and Cooling Tower Enclosure, RMS System Assessment and Code Compliance Upgrade, Design of Infrastructure and Utility Services for the PE Complex Building, Relocation of Boiler to Central Plant, and Design of Infrastructure and Utility Services for the Jaguar Gym.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) SJCC-04 in the amount of $169,500 to Salas O'Brien, for the Utility Extension Project Phase 2 for New and Existing Buildings.

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 9, 2014.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution authorizing the budget transfers and revisions of funds within expenditure accounts, authorizing the appropriation of the receipt of unanticipated revenues in certain programs, and authorizing the reversal of appropriations in certain programs due to the non-receipt of program revenues.

items.item_details: The AFT 6157 San Jose-Evergreen Federation of Teachers has requested the placement of this resolution on the agenda for approval by the Board of Trustees. The Resolution is a statewide effort to promote and obtain more resources for supporting our adjunct faculty in our ongoing efforts to improve student success and provide the best pathway forward for our students. Our district has long been a strong advocate for student success, and this resolution is part of a larger action to encourage the Governor and our legislators to focus necessary resources to allow our system to produce the desired outcome for our students, our state, and our country.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 011315-2 to Improve Student Success and Retention by Securing Additional Funding For Pay Equity and Paid Office Hours for Adjunct Faculty.

items.item_details:
Pursuant to California Education Code 84040, the governing board of each community college district shall provide for an annual audit of all funds, books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations established by the Board of Governors.  The audit shall be made by certified public accountants licensed by the California Board of Accountancy.
	 
Administrative Procedure 6400 requires the identification of all expenditures by source of funds and shall contain a summary of audit exceptions and management recommendations, which are to be presented to the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2013/2014 Independent Annual Financial and Audit Report conducted by Crowe Horwath, LLP.
items.item_text: San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2013/2014 Independent Annual Financial and Audit Report
items.item_text_raw: 3. San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2013/2014 Independent Annual Financial and Audit Report

items.item_details:
Pursuant to California Education Code 84040, the governing board of each community college district shall provide for an annual audit of all funds, books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations established by the Board of Governors.  The audit shall be made by certified public accountants licensed by the California Board of Accountancy.
	 
Additionally the ballot measure approved by the voters in November 2004 requires an annual financial and performance audit pursuant to Proposition 39.
	 
Administrative Procedure 6400 requires a summary of audit exceptions and management recommendations, which are to be presented to the Board of Trustees.  During the audit there were no internal control deficiencies identified; there were no instances of non-compliance or other matters identified; and the funds were expended in accordance with the ballot language and Proposition 39.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Fiscal Year 2013/2014 2004 General Obligation Bonds (Measure G - 2004) Independent Annual Financial and Performance Audit Reports conducted by Crowe Horwath, LLP.

Pursuant to California Education Code 84040, the governing board of each community college district shall provide for an annual audit of all books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations established by the Board of Governors.  The audit shall be made by certified public accountants licensed by the California Board of Accountancy.
	 
Additionally the ballot measure approved by the voters in November 2010 requires an annual financial and performance audit pursuant to Proposition 39.
	 
Administrative Procedure 6400 requires a summary of audit exceptions and management recommendations, which are to be presented to the Board of Trustees.  During the audit there were no internal control deficiencies identified; there were no instances of non-compliance or other matters identified; and the funds were expended in accordance with the ballot language and Proposition 39.

items.item_details:
Pursuant to California Education Code 84040, the governing board of each community college district shall provide for an annual audit of all funds, books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations established by the Board of Governors.  The audit shall be made by certified public accountants licensed by the California Board of Accountancy.
	 
Additionally Section 15.02(i) of the Other Post Employment Benefits (OPEB) Trust Agreement requires the deliverance of an unqualified opinion in connection with the report.
	 
Administrative Procedure 6400 requires a summary of audit exceptions and management recommendations, which are to be presented to the Board of Trustees.  During the audit there were no internal control deficiencies identified nor were there any instances of non-compliance or other matters identified.

items.item_details:
In accordance with state guidelines, Evergreen Valley Collegeâs Student Equity Plan focuses on increasing access, course completion, ESL and basic skills completion, degrees, certificates and transfer for all disadvantaged populations disproportionately impacted as measured by success indicators.  Title 5 regulations specify that colleges must review and address the following populations when looking at disproportionate impact: American Indians or Alaskan natives, Asians or Pacific Islanders, Blacks, Hispanics, Whites, men, women, and persons with disabilities (Â§54220(d)).  Additionally, State Budget trailer bill SB 860 (2014), added requirements to target foster youth, veterans and low income students.  
	 
Evergreen Valley College requests board approval of its 2014-2017 Student Equity Plan written and developed by the Student Success Committee in collaboration with the Office of Institutional Research and Student Success.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Evergreen Valley College's 2014-2017 Student Equity Plan.
items.item_text: Evergreen Valley College Student Equity Plan

items.item_details: The State Chancellor's Office requires each California Community College to submit a Student Equity Plan by January 15, 2015. This student equity planning process is for colleges to conduct a self-evaluation on their own improvement, or lack thereof, in improving successful outcomes for all students.  Colleges are required to coordinate interventions or services to students at risk of academic progress or probation.  The attached document has been provided to the appropriate constituency groups for feedback and suggestions. The State also requires that each Board of Trustees approve the document before submitting it to the State Chancellor's Office.  Therefore, San Jose City College is requesting that the SJECCD Board of Trustees approve the SJCC 2014 Student Equity Plan.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the SJCC 2014 Student Equity Plan.
items.item_text: San Jose City College Student Equity Plan
items.item_text_raw: 9. San Jose City College Student Equity Plan

items.item_details:
Proposition 39, which governs the District’s general obligation bonds, requires the establishment of a citizens’ oversight committee.  Following the passage of Measure G-2004 on November 2, 2004, the Board of Trustees took action on May 10, 2005 to establish a Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee. Measure G-2010 was passed by the voters on November 2, 2010, after which the Board of Trustees took action on December 14, 2010 to amend and restate the bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
	 
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) is required by statute to meet at least annually to review the District’s Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 bond projects plan and to ensure that bond funds are being appropriately used as authorized by the voters.  There are no penalties defined in law for failure to convene a citizens’ oversight committee; however, the spirit of the law contemplates that districts will make every reasonable effort to ensure that the committee functions at least once each year to fulfill its statutory duties.  The current CBOC convenes quarterly for meetings.
	 
Pursuant to Proposition 39, the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee is required to have a minimum of seven (7) members comprised of one (1) student active in a community college support group, such as student government, two (2) Community-At-Large members, one (1) Senior Citizens’ Organization member, one (1) Business Community member, (1) Tax Payer’s Association member and one (1) Support Organization member.  It is requested that the following applicants be appointed for a term to the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee by the Board of Trustees. 
	 
New Member                            Representing                           Term
Matthew Mahood                       Business Community Member     1                      
Elias Portales                            Community-At-Large                    1
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees appoint the following Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee applicants to fill the current vacancies on the committee.

items.item_details:
The attached resolution represents the next step in the process toward development of the 27.1 acres of surplus land adjoining the Evergreen Valley College campus.  The resolution addresses the bidding protocols, and terms and conditions related to the selection process.

items.item_details:
Staff will review the process and methodology for Board of Trustees Ends Policies Dashboard.  During each Board meeting, the trustees will receive an at-a-glance dashboard for review.  Consistent with the Board Calendar adopted on December 9, 2014, at each meeting, the Board will receive the Board Ends Policies Dashboard. Then, at specified subsequent meetings, the Board will receive in-depth monitoring reports at as follows:
	 
	Global Ends Statement: March 10, 2015
	Career Development and Transfer: May 26, 2015
	College Readiness; Student Success:  September 8, 2015
	Institutional Effectiveness; College Experience: December 8, 2015
	 
	The methodology for determining the dashboard indicators is based upon a rating system developed by the Office of Institutional Effectiveness and Student Success.  Each of the ends policy metrics is measured against a target chosen based on national, state, or local comparisons.  Each metric is then "red lighted" based upon its status compared to the target.  These metrics are part of the detail that make up the aggregated rating for each of the ends policy measures.  The attached dashboard is expected to change as the underlying metrics change.
items.item_text: Board Ends Policies Dashboard Overview
items.item_text_raw: 2. Board Ends Policies Dashboard Overview

items.item_details:
Staff will review the results of the 2014 Student Success Scorecard for San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College.  The Scorecard measures the success of students by tracking their progress along the pathway to completion of degrees, certificates, and transfer.  The outcomes tracked by the Student Success Scorecard are:
		 
Student Progress & Achievement Rate
Persistence Rate
30 Unit Achievement Rate
Basic Skills & ESL Progression Rate
Career & Technical Education Completion Rate
		 
		 
Each year, the California Community College Chancellor's Office will report on the status of these outcomes as a part of the State Chancellor's accountability reporting to the Governor.  The results for each are made public the results are can be used for comparison purposes.  Each college is required to share these data with the local Board of Trustees and inform the State Chancellor's office of the date of that report.
